Description: Rim and body sherd of Western Nile Delta (?) pottery deep bowl (?) with short out-turned rim; red clay with large quantity of gold mica inclusions; large limestone inclusions; and orange clay particles.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This vessel is part of a group of sherds with the accession number H2016. Each sherd is then separated on the database with a brief description but none resemble this sherd. Sherd has a tag that reads '0062 TET'.
This is perhaps part of a kiln support of doughnut shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.076)
